attributes.action: At least 40% of sports coverage on BBC (radio and TV) should relate to womens' sports
attributes.additional_details:
As part of the BBC Charter renewal in 2016, the BBC should be obliged to give fair coverage to womens' sports to reflect the population which pays the licence fee.
A minimum of 40% of coverage should be required.  Increased media coverage will lead to increased participation, spectator support and commercial support - a key legacy of our Olympics.  A minimum of 40% of coverage should be required.

rejection.details: Responsibility for what is broadcast on television and radio rests with the broadcasters and the organisations which regulate broadcasting - the Office of Communications (OFCOM), the BBC Trust and the Welsh Fourth Channel Authority (S4C). They are independent of the Government.
